snippet: Leonard A. Lauder, the cosmetics tycoon, will donate his collection of 78 pieces of Cubist art to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, filling a glaring gap.
abstract: Philanthropist and cosmetics tycoon Leonard A Lauder will donate his collection of 78 pieces of Cubist art to Metropolitan Museum of Art; trove of signature works, including 33 Picassos, is valued at more than $1 billion, and fills glaring gap in Met's collection, which has been notably weak in early-20th-century art.
lead_paragraph: Leonard A. Lauder, the cosmetics tycoon, will donate his collection of 78 pieces of Cubist art to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, filling a glaring gap.

headline.seo: Leonard Lauder Is Giving His Cubist Collection to the Met
headline.main: A Billion-Dollar Gift Gives the Met a New Perspective (Cubist)
headline.print_headline: $1 Billion Gift Gives Met a New Perspective (Cubist)
